title: Available Maps
text: 50 US states
code: get_coordinates(map = "usa50", coords = "hexmap") |>    ggplot() +    geom_sf(fill = "grey35", color = "white") +    geom_sf_text(aes(label = abbr_usps), color = "white") +    theme_void()

text: 50 US States District Columbia.

title: Available Maps
text: 50 US States, District Columbia, territories (Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, American Samoa, Northern Marina Islands) freely associated states (Micronesia, Marshall Islands Palau).
code: get_coordinates(map = "usa59", coords = "hexmap") |>    ggplot() +    geom_sf(fill = "grey35", color = "white") +    geom_sf_text(aes(label = abbr_usps), color = "white") +    theme_void()

title: Available Maps
text: 50 US States, District Columbia (DC), 5 territories (Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, American Samoa, Northern Marina Islands), freely associated state Palau. WIOA: Workforce Innovation Opportunity (workforce dev. legislation) ETA: Department Labor’s Employment Training Administration ETA regions rarely plotted , nice add border group states region together.
code: get_coordinates(map = "usaETA", coords = "hexmap") |>    ggplot() +    geom_sf(aes(fill = eta_region_name), color = "white") +    geom_sf(data = get_coordinates("usaETAregions", "hexmap"),            fill = NA, color = "grey35", linewidth = 1) +    geom_sf_text(aes(label = abbr_usps), color = "white") +    theme_void()

title: CSR for Map
text: ’s possible ‘square’ hex map changing coordinate reference system (CRS) WGS 84 / Pseudo-Mercator CRS (EPSG code 3857).
code: sf_latlong <- st_transform(sf_latlong, 3857) gg1 <- ggplot(sf_latlong) +    geom_sf() +   geom_sf_text(aes(label=abbr_usps)) +   labs(title = "latlong - hexagons look the same size when change CRS to 3857") +    theme_void()  gg2 <- ggplot(sf_usahex) +    geom_sf() +    geom_sf_text(aes(label=abbr_usps)) +   labs(title = "usahex - all hexagons are the same size without CRS") +    theme_void()  plot_grid(gg1, gg2, nrow = 1)

title: CSR for Map
text: order plot two different labels, need two different points. latlong hex map usahex map need transformed. latlong needs large numbers order adjust plot location (+/- 100000) becuase coordinates actual lat/long values. usahex maps needs small +/- 5 units adjust labels.
code: gg1 <-ggplot(sf_latlong) +    geom_sf() +   geom_sf_text(     data = mutate(sf_latlong, geometry = geometry + c(0, 100000)) |>        sf::st_set_crs(3857),       aes(label=abbr_usps),      fontface = "bold",      size = 3.25   ) +   geom_sf_text(     data = mutate(sf_latlong, geometry = geometry + c(0, -100000)) |>        sf::st_set_crs(3857),       aes(label=fips),      size = 2.25   ) +   labs(title = "latlong -large adjustment values") +    theme_void()  gg2 <- ggplot(sf_usahex) +    geom_sf() +      geom_sf_text(     data = mutate(sf_usahex, geometry = geometry + c(0, 5)),       aes(label=abbr_usps),      fontface = "bold",      size = 3.25   ) +   geom_sf_text(     data = mutate(sf_usahex, geometry = geometry + c(0, -5)),       aes(label=fips),      size = 2.25   ) +   labs(title = "usahex - small adjustment values") +    theme_void()  plot_grid(gg1, gg2, nrow = 1)

title: CSR for Map
text: Although R package data require CRS, geojson data avialable github CRS. order geojson files ‘play nice’ needed make updated coordinates. original coordinates fit onto map many hexagon values fall outside lat/long boundaries. adjusted coordinates make hex map smaller shifted map middle pacific ocean (based lat/long coordinates). Finally added common CRS WGS 84 / Pseudo-Mercator (EPSG code 3857). ’m hoping adjustments make geojson files easy plot. can view difference coordinates easily reviewing state: output either file look (evenly sized hexagons), different coordinates:
code: link <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/MarEichler/usahex/refs/heads/main/data-raw/geojson/usa56.geojson" usa56_gj <- sf::read_sf(link)  usa56 <- get_coordinates("usa56")  filter(usa56_gj, abbr_usps == "AL") |> pull(geometry) #> Geometry set for 1 feature  #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -157.4135 ymin: -2.5 xmax: -153.0833 ymax: 2.5 #> Projected CRS: WGS 84 / Pseudo-Mercator #> POLYGON ((-155.2484 2.5, -153.0833 1.25, -153.0... filter(usa56,    abbr_usps == "AL") |> pull(geometry) #> Geometry set for 1 feature  #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 260.6922 ymin: -220 xmax: 295.3332 ymax: -180 #> CRS:           NA #> POLYGON ((278.0127 -180, 295.3332 -190, 295.333... gg_gj <- ggplot(usa56_gj) +    geom_sf() +   geom_sf_text(aes(label = abbr_gpo), size = 2.5) +    labs(title = "adj coordinates for geojson files", x = NULL, y = NULL)  gg_pkg <- ggplot(usa56) +    geom_sf() +   geom_sf_text(aes(label = abbr_gpo), size = 2.5) +    labs(title = "default coordiantes from package", x = NULL, y = NULL)  plot_grid(gg_gj, gg_pkg, nrow = 1)

title: Geography Abbreviations and Information
text: 2-letter code used United States Postal Service (USPS). USPS abbreviations pulled Wikipedia’s List U.S. state territory abbreviations.

title: Geography Abbreviations and Information
text: Abbreviations US Government Printing Office (GPO). GPO abbreviations pulled Wikipedia’s List U.S. state territory abbreviations. Freely associated states (Micronesia, Marshall Islands, Palau) GPO abbreviations

title: Geography Abbreviations and Information
text: Abbreviations AP Stylebook. AP abbreviations pulled Wikipedia’s List U.S. state territory abbreviations. Territories (Guam, Northern Mariana Islands, Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands) freely associated states (Micronesia, Marshall Islands, Palau) AP abbreviations

title: Geography Abbreviations and Information
text: Abbreviation name geography either 3-4 characters

title: Geography Abbreviations and Information
text: Abbreviation name geography 5-6 characters, except : 4 geographies whose name less 5 characters; use full names (Iowa, Ohio, Utah, Guam) Northern Mariana Islands = N.Mar.. Marshall Islands = Mar.. U.S. Virgin Islands = U.S.V..

title: Geography Abbreviations and Information
text: Name geographic area. Names pulled Wikipedia’s List U.S. state territory abbreviations.

title: Geography Abbreviations and Information
text: 2-digit FIPS code (Federal Information Processing Standard). FIPS codes pulled Wikipedia’s List U.S. state territory abbreviations.

title: Geography Abbreviations and Information
text: Type region: state, federal district, territory, freely associated state

title: Highcharts
text: Population Change US 2010 2020, pulled Wikipedia using code
code: other_data <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/MarEichler/usahex/refs/heads/main/data-raw/us_population_change_2010_to_2020.csv")

title: Highcharts
text: highcharter works geojson/json ’easies import geojson file github
code: link <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/MarEichler/usahex/refs/heads/main/data-raw/geojson/usa56.geojson" hex_map <- fromJSON(file = link) # need jsonlite AND rjson package for this code to work

title: Highcharts
text: Prep display data. Prep highchart object
code:
values_to_plot <-other_data |> # create new variables mutate( category = cut( perc, breaks = c( -20, -10 , -5, 5, 10, 20), labels = c("less than -10%", "-10% to -5%", "-5% to 5%", "5% to 10%", "more than 10%"), ), # recreate perc_label so only 1 digit perc_label = scales::comma(perc, accuracy = 0.1, suffix = "%"), # variable did population inc/decrease inc_dec = case_when( n == 0 ~ "did not change", n > 0 ~ "increased", n < 0 ~ "decreased" ) ) |> # join with geo abbr & info right_join( sf::st_drop_geometry(usahex::get_coordinates("usa56")), by = "name" ) |> # create and style the tool tip mutate( tooltip = paste0( "", name, "
", "Population ",inc_dec, " by ", scales::comma(abs(n)), " people (", scales::comma(abs(perc), accuracy = 0.1, suffix = "%"), ") from 2010 to 2020" ) ) map_theme <- hc_theme( chart = list(style = list(fontFamily = "Arial", color = "#666666")), title = list( style = list( fontFamily = "Arial", fontWeight = "bold", color = "black", fontSize = "30px" ) ) ) color_scale <- c("#D01C8B", "#F1B6DA", "#F7F7F7", "#B8E186","#4DAC26") min_map <- min(values_to_plot$perc, na.rm = TRUE) max_map <- max(values_to_plot$perc, na.rm = TRUE)

title: Highcharts
code:
highchart() |> hc_add_series_map( map = hex_map, df = values_to_plot, joinBy = "name", value = "perc", dataLabels = list( enabled = TRUE, useHTML = TRUE, formatter = JS( "function() {return '
' + '' + this.point.abbr_gpo + '
' + '' + this.point.perc_label + '' + '
';}" ) ), nullColor = "#e8e8e8", accessibility = list( point = list( valueDescriptionFormat = "geography: {point.name}, value of interest: {point.pop_change:.1f}" ) ) ) |> # style hc object hc_colorAxis( min = min_map, max = max_map, stops = color_stops(5, color_scale), labels = list(format = "{value}%") ) |> hc_legend( align = "right", layout = "vertical", verticalAlign = "bottom" ) |> # add title and tool tips hc_title(text = "Population Change, 2010 to 2020") |> hc_tooltip( formatter = JS("function(){return(this.point.tooltip)}"), outside = TRUE ) |> # add theme hc_add_theme(map_theme)

title: Highcharts
text: Highcharter work automatically discrete variables way ggplot. order plot discrete variables highchater hex map, need section data add category individually.
code:
add_cat_to_hex_map <- function(hc, df, cat, color){ hc |> hc_add_series( name = cat, data = filter(df, category == cat), dataLabels = list( enabled = TRUE, useHTML = TRUE, formatter = JS("function() {return '
' + '' + this.point.abbr_gpo + '
' + '' + this.point.perc_label + '' + '
';}") ), color = color, accessibility = list( point = list( valueDescriptionFormat = "geography: {point.name}, value of interest: {point.pop_change:.1f}" ) ) ) } highchart(type = "map") |> hc_plotOptions(map = list( allAreas = FALSE, joinBy = c("name"), mapData = hex_map )) |> add_cat_to_hex_map(values_to_plot, "less than -10%", color = color_scale[1]) |> add_cat_to_hex_map(values_to_plot, "-10% to 5%" , color = color_scale[2]) |> add_cat_to_hex_map(values_to_plot, "-5% to 5%" , color = color_scale[3]) |> add_cat_to_hex_map(values_to_plot, "5% to 10%" , color = color_scale[4]) |> add_cat_to_hex_map(values_to_plot, "more than 10%" , color = color_scale[5]) |> hc_legend( align = "right", layout = "horizontal", verticalAlign = "bottom" ) |> # add title and tool tips hc_title(text = "Population Change, 2010 to 2020") |> hc_tooltip( formatter = JS("function(){return(this.point.tooltip)}"), outside = TRUE ) |> # add theme hc_add_theme(map_theme)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Martha Eichlersmith. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Eichlersmith M (2025). usahex: Hex Maps USA Geographies (states, federal district, territories, freely associated states). R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://mareichler.github.io/usahex/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {usahex: Hex Maps of USA Geographies (states, federal district, territories, and freely associated states)},   author = {Martha Eichlersmith},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://mareichler.github.io/usahex/}, }

what: Hex Maps of USA Geographies (states, federal district, territories, and freely associated states)
title: Hex Maps of USA Geographies (states, federal district, territories, and freely associated states)
text: simple packages includes hex maps United States multiple options different geographies. hex maps available public use 50 states + DC: R Graph Gallery Datawrapper. CDC Open-Source Visualization Editor (COVE) puts hexagons line bottom 50 states + DC hex map account territories freely associated states. However, coordinates provided json file available cdc-open-vis GitHub 50 states + DC. benefit usahex includes hex maps territories freely associated states. hex maps? clear way display information geography basis choropleth maps using metrics related land size; traditional lat/long maps -emphasize large-land geographies -emphasize small-land geographies hex maps allow enough space geography id label value label

title: Hex Maps of USA Geographies (states, federal district, territories, and freely associated states)
text: usahex uses sf package (sf = simple features) create shape objects easy plot using ggplot2 package, preferred medium data visualizations.
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("mareichler/usahex")

title: Hex Maps of USA Geographies (states, federal district, territories, and freely associated states)
code: library(usahex) library(ggplot2) allgeos <- get_coordinates(map = "usa59", coords = "hexmap") |>    ggplot() +    geom_sf(aes(fill = geo_type)) +    geom_sf_text(aes(label = abbr_usps), size = 3.5) +    theme_void() allgeos

title: Hex Maps of USA Geographies (states, federal district, territories, and freely associated states)
text: files can found data-raw/geojson folder GitHub.
code: geojson <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/MarEichler/usahex/refs/heads/main/data-raw/geojson/usa56.geojson" df <- sf::read_sf(geojson)   gggeojson <- ggplot(df) +    geom_sf() +   geom_sf_text(aes(label = abbr_gpo), size = 3) +    theme_void() gggeojson

title: Hex Maps of USA Geographies (states, federal district, territories, and freely associated states)
text: files can found data-raw/csv folder GitHub. X Y coordinates 7 coordinates state create hexagon. cX cY repeated center coordinates create single point center given hexagons. raw files can also used create ggplot2 items don’t want work simple features (sf) objects:
code: csv <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/MarEichler/usahex/refs/heads/main/data-raw/csv/usa53.csv" read.csv(csv)[1:14,c(2,6, 10:13)] ##    abbr_usps abbr_long         X    Y        cX   cY ## 1         AL     Alab. 278.01270 -180 278.01270 -200 ## 2         AL     Alab. 295.33321 -190 278.01270 -200 ## 3         AL     Alab. 295.33321 -210 278.01270 -200 ## 4         AL     Alab. 278.01270 -220 278.01270 -200 ## 5         AL     Alab. 260.69219 -210 278.01270 -200 ## 6         AL     Alab. 260.69219 -190 278.01270 -200 ## 7         AL     Alab. 278.01270 -180 278.01270 -200 ## 8         AK    Alaska  35.52559    0  35.52559  -20 ## 9         AK    Alaska  52.84610  -10  35.52559  -20 ## 10        AK    Alaska  52.84610  -30  35.52559  -20 ## 11        AK    Alaska  35.52559  -40  35.52559  -20 ## 12        AK    Alaska  18.20508  -30  35.52559  -20 ## 13        AK    Alaska  18.20508  -10  35.52559  -20 ## 14        AK    Alaska  35.52559    0  35.52559  -20 df <- read.csv(csv)   # only need 1coord per state labels <- dplyr::distinct(dplyr::select(df, -c(X, Y)))  ggcsv <- ggplot(df, aes(group=abbr_usps)) +   geom_polygon(aes(x=X, y=Y), color = "white", fill = "grey35") +   geom_text(     data=labels,      aes(label=abbr_long, x = cX, y = cY),      size = 3,      color = "white"   ) +   coord_fixed() +    theme_void() ggcsv

title: Hex Maps of USA Geographies (states, federal district, territories, and freely associated states)
text: Back covid times, NPR used hex maps (included US territories) show different covid related metrics. reached Alyson Hurt, Supervising Graphics Editor pointed dailygraphics-templates file GitHub contained coordinates map. ’ve made small adjustments, moving pacific island hexagons around adding new hexagons account freely associated states; coordinates basis maps package. y values reversed plot upside .

title: Import hex map coordinates — get_coordinates
text: Import hex map coordinates

title: Import hex map coordinates — get_coordinates
code: get_coordinates(map = NULL, coords = "hexmap")

title: Import hex map coordinates — get_coordinates
text: map character string specifying map. Current options "usa50" (50 US States ), "usa51" (50 states DC), "usa52" (50 states, DC, Puerto Rico), "usa53" (50 states, DC, PUerto Rico Virgin Islands), "usa56" (50 states, DC, territories (PR, VI, , GU, MP)), "usa56" (50 states, DC, territories (PR, VI, , GU, MP), freely associate states (FM, MH, PW)), "usaETA" (US DOL ETA geographies, usa56 addition freely associate state Palau), "usaETARegions" (unified maps US DOL ETA regions) . coords character string specifying "hexmap" hexagon coordinates "labels" label coordinates hex map

title: Import hex map coordinates — get_coordinates
text: sf object map, either hexagons (polygon) labels (point).

title: Import hex map coordinates — get_coordinates
code: get_coordinates(map = "usa50", coords = "hexmap") #> Simple feature collection with 50 features and 8 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 0.8845727 ymin: -250 xmax: 433.8973 ymax: 0 #> CRS:           NA #> # A tibble: 50 × 9 #>    abbr_usps abbr_gpo abbr_ap abbr_short abbr_long name        fips  geo_type #>    <fct>     <fct>    <fct>   <chr>      <chr>     <fct>       <chr> <fct>    #>  1 AL        Ala.     Ala.    Ala.       Alab.     Alabama     01    state    #>  2 AK        Alaska   Alaska  Ak.        Alaska    Alaska      02    state    #>  3 AZ        Ariz.    Ariz.   Arz.       Ariz.     Arizona     04    state    #>  4 AR        Ark.     Ark.    Ark.       Arkan.    Arkansas    05    state    #>  5 CA        Calif.   Calif.  Cal.       Calif.    California  06    state    #>  6 CO        Colo.    Colo.   Col.       Colo.     Colorado    08    state    #>  7 CT        Conn.    Conn.   Con.       Conn.     Connecticut 09    state    #>  8 DE        Del.     Del.    Del.       Dela.     Delaware    10    state    #>  9 FL        Fla.     Fla.    Fla.       Flor.     Florida     12    state    #> 10 GA        Ga.      Ga.     Ga.        Georg.    Georgia     13    state    #> # ℹ 40 more rows #> # ℹ 1 more variable: geometry <POLYGON> get_coordinates(map = "usa50", coords = "labels") #> Simple feature collection with 50 features and 8 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 18.20508 ymin: -230 xmax: 416.5768 ymax: -20 #> CRS:           NA #> # A tibble: 50 × 9 #>    abbr_usps abbr_gpo abbr_ap abbr_short abbr_long name        fips  geo_type #>  * <fct>     <fct>    <fct>   <chr>      <chr>     <fct>       <chr> <fct>    #>  1 AL        Ala.     Ala.    Ala.       Alab.     Alabama     01    state    #>  2 AK        Alaska   Alaska  Ak.        Alaska    Alaska      02    state    #>  3 AZ        Ariz.    Ariz.   Arz.       Ariz.     Arizona     04    state    #>  4 AR        Ark.     Ark.    Ark.       Arkan.    Arkansas    05    state    #>  5 CA        Calif.   Calif.  Cal.       Calif.    California  06    state    #>  6 CO        Colo.    Colo.   Col.       Colo.     Colorado    08    state    #>  7 CT        Conn.    Conn.   Con.       Conn.     Connecticut 09    state    #>  8 DE        Del.     Del.    Del.       Dela.     Delaware    10    state    #>  9 FL        Fla.     Fla.    Fla.       Flor.     Florida     12    state    #> 10 GA        Ga.      Ga.     Ga.        Georg.    Georgia     13    state    #> # ℹ 40 more rows #> # ℹ 1 more variable: geometry <POINT>

title: usa50 shapefile data — usa50
text: Simple feature collection abbr_usps 2-letter code used United States Postal Service abbr_gpo abbreviations US Government Printing Office abbr_ap abbreviations AP Stylebook abbr_short abbreviations 3-4 characters abbr_long abbreviations 4-8 characters, 5-6 characters name Name geographic area fips 2-digit FIPS code (Federal Information Processing Standard) geo_type Type region: state, federal district, territory, freely associated state geometry polygon coordinates hexagon
